required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Needle Puncture Point During Central Venous Catheterization With Ultrasound Guidance
clinical_study.official_title: Position of Puncture Point of the Introducer Needle During Internal Jugular Venous Catheterization With Ultrasound Guidance

brief_summary.textblock: In this observational study, we will measure the shortest distance from the cricoid cartilage level to the puncture site of the introducer needle when anesthesiologists perform central venous catheterization.

detailed_description.textblock: After anesthesia induction and tracheal intubation, we will prepare central venous catheterization for patients requiring it. After anesthesiologists who are blinded to this study perform central venous catheterization, an investigator measured the shortest distance from the crease line of the cricoid cartilage to the puncture site of the introducer needle.

primary_outcome.description: distance from the crease line of the cricoid cartilage to the puncture site of the introducer needle

intervention.description: central venous catheterization through the right internal jugular vein

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (>18 years old) scheduled to elective surgery requiring central venous catheterization under general anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective surgery under general anesthesia
- requirement of central venous catheterization
Exclusion Criteria:
- disagreement for participation

facility.name: Seoul Metropolitan Government Seoul National University Boramae Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: If there would be a proper reason, I will share the data to other researchers.
